Articles.Content:
Greetings!

Recently, I tried to change my signature but I simply couldn't delete the video content inside of it. In the editor, I tried highlighting the video and pressing "backspace", but that nothing happened. Additionally, I tried to type in the editor and again, nothing happened. I even tried to insert an image into the editor and once again, nothing happened.

At this point, I am at a loss of ideas. The only idea I have is that since I made this signature before the 2015 forum migration, it might be a bug with the new forums. So, could anyone tell me what is going on here? Is this a bug in the forums, or am I just missing something? If it is a bug, then is there a way for a moderator to remove the content from my signature so that I could edit it?

Have you tried writing something below it, Ctl A and Delete?

EDIT: or just Crl A? If it doesn't work ask a moderator.

Edited January 23, 2016 by RA3236
Stratzenblitz75, I click-dragged to highlight the vid, then hit delete. Seemed to do the job for you.

23 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:

Stratzenblitz75, I click-dragged to highlight the vid, then hit delete. Seemed to do the job for you.

Huh, I tried that as well, but it didn't seem to work. In fact, even though my signature is gone from my posts, the video content is still in the editor!

However, I figured it out: Pressing "undo" made the video go away and now I can edit my signature... Whew, I was starting to think I was cursed.
